message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I'm being asked to respond as a primary or secondary school teacher from Korea to a survey about AI in education. I need to provide responses to 10 statements about AI in education using the available response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

Let me think about reasonable responses from the perspective of a Korean teacher with practical experience in education:

TT4G35A - AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans: This is generally true. AI tools can assist with this. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35B - AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities: This is a capability of AI systems. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35C - AI assists teachers in supporting students individually: AI can provide personalized support. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35D - AI supports students with specific needs: This is a known benefit of AI. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35E - AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks: This is true. I'd say "Strongly agree" as this is one of the clearest benefits

TT4G35F - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own: This is a legitimate concern - students could use AI-generated text. I'd say "Agree" as this is a real risk

TT4G35G - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct: This is a known limitation of AI. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35H - AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions: This is a real concern with AI. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35I - AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data: This is a legitimate concern. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35J - AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches: This could happen if AI is not well-designed. 

I'd say "Agree"

Now I'll structure this as a function call with the json_tool_call function.
